attributes.action: Commercial leasing landlords to take some risk on the business failure.
attributes.additional_details: A Commercial Landlord is in the wonderful position of sitting back while their tenant struggles to make a business work. If it is a long-term lease is in place without a natural break, this means that a Company Director can lose everything, while the Landlord takes no risk, other than having to take legal action. When taking out a lease you cannot predict redevelopment in other areas that may take business away or changing markets, so no lease should be closed without a break clause.
attributes.background: Commercial landlords insisting Companies do not trade as Limited, means Directors are forced to take personal responsibility for the future e.g. 25 years.  If a lease is long-term without natural break, this means the Landlord is taking no risk, whereas the Director can lose their home/everything.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. You could start a petition which outlines what specific action you would like the UK Government and Parliament to take.
